info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 1:47AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR WASHINGTON AND CENTRAL ADAIR COUNTIES... At 147 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles east of Siloam Springs to 6 miles southeast of Stilwell, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Stilwell... Farmington... Prairie Grove... Elkins... West Fork... Lincoln... Westville... Greenland... Winslow... Adair State Park... Christie... Cincinnati... Blackburn... Maryetta... Baron... Devils Den State Park... Brentwood... Strickler... Drake Field Airport... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 41 and 64. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
